meanings.definition: A horse used for carrying goods on its back.
meanings.sent1: The packhorse trotted along the mountain trail with bags of supplies.
meanings.sent2: The packhorse was essential for transporting the heavy equipment to the campsite.
meanings.sent3: The packhorse seemed to grumble under the weight of all the camping gear.
meanings.sent4: The packhorse bore the burden of our provisions stoically.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sturdy packhorse trudging through the wilderness stayed with us.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that carries a heavy load or burden.
meanings.sent1: As the packhorse of the team, he always carried the heaviest boxes.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a packhorse lugging around her backpack full of textbooks.
meanings.sent3: The packhorse of the office, he was always tasked with moving the heavy furniture.
meanings.sent4: Carrying the emotional weight of others, she felt like a packhorse of feelings.
meanings.sent5: He was the packhorse of the family, always shouldering everyone's problems.
